com.sillysoft.lux

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.sillysoft.lux.Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board is the connection between the game world and agents. Commands such as choosing countries or attacking are all ordered through calls to the Board during the proper turn phase. The Board also contains some methods for querying the game state and parameters. When initialized, each agent is sent a reference to a Board object to interact with. An important data structure available through the Board is the array of Country's in the game. Available through the getCountries() method, this array contains all aspects of the current board position.

    • Method Detail

      • cashCards

        public boolean cashCards(Card card,
                Card card2,
                Card card3)
        Cashes in the given card set. Each parameter must be a reference to a different Card instance sent via cardsPhase(). It returns true if the set was cashed, false otherwise.

      • placeArmies

        public void placeArmies(int numberOfArmies,
               Country country)
        Places numberOfArmies armies in the given country.

               int countryCode)

      • attack

        public int attack(Country attacker,
         Country defender,
         boolean attackTillDead)
        If attackTillDead is true then perform attacks until one side or the other has been defeated. Otherwise perform a single attack.

        This method may only be called from within an agent's attackPhase() method.

      • attack

        public int attack(int countryCodeAttacker,
         int countryCodeDefender,
         boolean attackTillDead)
        If attackTillDead is true then perform attacks until one side or the other has been defeated. Otherwise perform a single attack.

        This method may only be called from within an agent's attackPhase() method.

      • fortifyArmies

        public int fortifyArmies(int numberOfArmies,
                Country origin,
                Country destination)
        Order a fortification move. This method may only be called from within an agent's 'fortifyPhase()' method. It returns 1 on a successful fortify, 0 if no armies could be fortified (countries must always keep 1 army on them) and a negative number on failure.

      • fortifyArmies

        public int fortifyArmies(int numberOfArmies,
                int countryCodeOrigin,
                int countryCodeDestination)
        Order a fortification move. This method may only be called from within an agent's 'fortifyPhase()' method. It returns 1 on a successful fortify, 0 if no armies could be fortified (countries must always keep 1 army on them) and a negative number on failure.

      • getCountries

        public Country[] getCountries()
        Will return an array of all the countries in the game. The array is ordered by country code, so c[i].getCode() equals i.
